CloudBase Services

Web Design/HTML/CSS/JS/Wordpress

×

CloudBase Services

Type: Client Project

Role: Web Designer/Graphic Designer/Wordpress Developer

CloudBase Services provides a streamlined process that turns data into solutions, working with software compnaies like Salesforce to build custom backend dashboards and apps. They approached me to help them bring their brand and website into 2018. They wanted to portray an approachable, confident team that could help their clients reach their technology goals with ease. I worked on a small, nimble team with a UX copywriter and IT Specialist to update the website.

Jonny On It

UI/UX/Design

×

Johnny On It

Type: Client Project

Role: UI Designer

Jonny On It is a one-stop solution for real estate agents and homeowners to get connect with service professionals as quickly and conveniently as possible. The Jonny On It team reached out to me to help them improve the user experience of their onboarding process. By integrating their existing brand colors and themes, I was able to quickly iterate production-ready files for their development team.

Clap Back

HTML/CSS/JS

×

Clap Back

Type: Personal Project

Role: Designer/Developer

My goal as a developer right now is to get as good at Vanilla js as possible, but have fun doing it! I like to send messgaes to my friends with an emphasis on each word and I got really tired of copying and pasting the clap emoji, so I created a simple Javascript form to do it for me. I am currently in the process of making it into a Chrome Extension so I can have it whenever I want!

Anchor Clothing Ecommerce

Web Design/Logo/Branding

×

Anchor Clothing Ecommerce

Type: Personal Project

Role: Designer

Anchor Clothing came about from the 30 logos in 30 days challenge (which is sadly being removed from the internet as we speak). One of the challenges was to make a logo for a clothing company named "Anchor" that didn't fall into the trope of navy blue and white. I took it in a different, seafoam green direction and decided I might as well create an Ecommerce web store to match it. My next step is to build the whole site in WooCommerce or Shopify so I can get some experience with those as well.

The Detroit Chocolate Company

Web Design/HTML/CSS/JS/Wordpress

×

The Detroit Chocolate Company

Type: Client Project

Role: Designer/Wordpress Developer

The Detroit Chocolate Company creates custom chocolate orders for corporate clients that range from individual truffles to full towers of chocolate goodies. I helped the CEO redesign the logo and color scheme, and then took those elements and created a simple web design within the Wordpress framework that showcased the history of the company and what it had to offer.

Vent Busters

Web Design/HTML/CSS/Wordpress

×

Vent Busters

Type: Client Project

Role: Designer/Wordpress Developer

Vent Busters was a very fun project to work on because the mascot is just great. The client approached me to help build a logo around the mascot illustration and then liked it so much that he also asked if I would do the web design and development for him as well. The site is built on the Salient theme for Wordpress and was custom tailored for the client.
